title: Multisensory Tour
description: In the Multisensory Gallery, we invite you to use your senses to explore some of the materials that make up works of art. Lean in close to see tiny details. Tap an object to hear its gentle ring. Feel the weight or texture of the work. Trace lines and patterns in its surface. While we can’t touch art in the museum (our fingerprints can cause permanent damage), you can take what you’ve discovered here through multisensory play and head into the galleries to look at works of art anew.
intro: What makes a work of art? Works of art are a curious combination of ideas and physical materials. In the creative process artists use their senses to shape materials and give physical form to their ideas.
